Package cipher

Class FileIO

java.lang.Object
cipher.FileIO
public class FileIO
extends java.lang.Object
Class that manages all File IO operations for the project.

The primary serialisation / deserialistaion framework in use is Kryo

Author:
Max Wood

  • Method Details

    • readFile

      public java.lang.String[] readFile​(java.lang.String filename)
      Returns all lines in a text file as separate words in a string array.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A string array of each line in the file.

    • hash64

      public long hash64​(java.lang.String text)
      Gives the 64 bit FNV-1a hash of an input string.
      Parameters:
      text - The text from which the hash is to be generated.
      Returns:
      The hash of the input data.

    • generateHashMap

      public void generateHashMap​(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String outputFilename)
      Creates a hash-map using FNV1-a and each line of a given file of type .
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file which lines are to be read from.
      outputFilename - The name of the file to which the hashtable is saved.

    • readHashTable

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,​java.lang.String> readHashTable​(java.lang.String filename)
      Returns the hash-map that was stored in a given file. 10x Faster than previous method.
      Parameters:
      filename -
      Returns:
      Loaded hash-map.

    • cleanText

      public java.lang.String cleanText​(java.lang.String text)
      Cleans a given piece of text.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to be cleaned.
      Returns:
      The same text with only alphabetic characters, in lower case.

    • deSpace

      public java.lang.String deSpace​(java.lang.String text)
      Removes spaces from text.
      Parameters:
      text - Text to have spaces removed from.
      Returns:
      Un-spaced text.

    • readLetterFrequencies

      public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.Double> readLetterFrequencies​(java.lang.String filename)
      Returns the tree-map of letter frequencies that was stored in a specific file.
      Parameters:
      filename -
      Returns:
      Loaded map of letter frequencies.

    • generateLetterFrequencies

      public void generateLetterFrequencies​(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String outputFilename)
      Generates a tree-map of letter frequencies based on a text file.
      Parameters:
      filename - The file name of the text file to be read.

    • generateNGramMap

      public void generateNGramMap​(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String outputFilename, boolean characters, boolean log)
      Generates and saves a TreeMap from a file containing n-grams in English and their relative appearances in Google's trillion word corpus.
      Parameters:
      filename - The file the n-grams are to be fetched from.
      outputFilename - The file the n-gram map is to be stored in.
      characters - True if the n-grams are for characters rather than words.
      log - True if the log probabilities for the n-grams are to be stored.

    • loadNgramMap

      public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> loadNgramMap​(java.lang.String filename)
      Loads a TreeMap from a file containing NGrams in English and their respective log probabilities.
      Parameters:
      filename - The file from which the map is to be loaded from.

    • loadCharacterIndexForm

      public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String>> loadCharacterIndexForm​(java.lang.String filename)
      Loads a TreeMap containing p-equivalent n-grams.
      Parameters:
      filename - The file the map is to be recovered from.
      Returns:
      The TreeMap of p-equivalent n-grams.

    • generateCharacterIndexFormMap

      public void generateCharacterIndexFormMap​(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String outputFilename)
      Generates a map that stores a character index form encoding and all possible words that fit the pattern.
      Parameters:
      filename - The filename that the words to be encoded are stored in.
      outputFilename - The filename for the map to be stored in.
